edu.mit.jwi.data
Interface IDataProvider

All Superinterfaces:
IHasVersion
All Known Implementing Classes:
FileProvider
public interface IDataProvider
extends IHasVersion

Objects that implement this interface serve as managers of the relationship of a IDictionary object and the dictionary data. Before using an IDataProvider, the dictionary must call setSource(URL) (or call the appropriate constructor) and open().

When the dictionary wants to lookup a piece of data, it requests the IDataSource object that holds that data by passing the appropriate IContentType to the getSource(IContentType) method. The IDataSource interface then handles the actual production of the data from whatever resource backs it.

Since:
1.5.0
Version:
2.1.5, Nov. 16, 2007
Author:
Mark A. Finlayson

Method Summary
 void close()
          Instructs the provider to dispose of handles to current IDataSource objects and perform any other operations necessary to free the data resources that back the dictionary.
 java.net.URL getSource()
          Returns the URL that points to the resource location.
<T> IDataSource<T>
getSource(IContentType<T> type)
          Gets an IDataSource object for the specified content type.
 java.util.Collection<IDataSource<?>> getSources()
          Returns an unmodifiable Collection that contains all IDataSource objects to which the provider has access.
 boolean isOpen()
          Returns true if the provider has finished all of its initialization activities and is ready to return IDataSource objects on command; returns false otherwise.
 void open()
          Instructs the data provider to perform any initialization.
 void setSource(java.net.URL url)
          This method must be called with the appropriate URL that directs the file provider to the data that backs the dictionary.
 
Methods inherited from interface edu.mit.jwi.item.IHasVersion
getVersion
 

Method Detail

setSource

void setSource(java.net.URL url)
This method must be called with the appropriate URL that directs the file provider to the data that backs the dictionary. If the data provider has already been opened, this call will have no effect until the provider is closed then opened again.

getSource

java.net.URL getSource()
Returns the URL that points to the resource location.

open

void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
Instructs the data provider to perform any initialization.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem during initialization

close

void close()
Instructs the provider to dispose of handles to current IDataSource objects and perform any other operations necessary to free the data resources that back the dictionary. A subsequent call to open() should put the provider in a state where it can again provide IDataSource objects.

isOpen

boolean isOpen()
Returns true if the provider has finished all of its initialization activities and is ready to return IDataSource objects on command; returns false otherwise.

getSources

java.util.Collection<IDataSource<?>> getSources()
Returns an unmodifiable Collection that contains all IDataSource objects to which the provider has access.

getSource

<T> IDataSource<T> getSource(IContentType<T> type)
Gets an IDataSource object for the specified content type.
